Description:
The FHIR ProcedureRequest resource defines a request for a procedure to be planned, proposed, or performed. This includes diagnostic investigations, counseling, therapies, surgeries or procedures, exercises, and other clinical interventions. The results of this procedure are available in the Procedure resource or the DiagnosticReport resource.

An example workflow is a clinical system orders a diagnostic test for a patient and sends it to a diagnostic service. The diagnostic service accepts the request, performs the test, marks the request as complete, and finally issues a diagnostic report with details of the test.

encounter.Name: encounter
encounter.Optional: Either this or patient/subject must be provided.

patient.Name: patient
patient.Optional: Either this or subject or encounter must be provided.

requester.Name: requester
requester.Description: Reference to a practitioner resource who is the authorizing provider for the procedure request. Default is all.

status.Name: status
status.Description: The status code to filter the search. The full list of potential values can be found here. The default is to return active ProcedureRequests.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Optional: Either this or patient or encounter must be provided.

Bundle.Name: Bundle
Bundle.Description: Resource bundle. For more information, refer to the FHIR specification.

entry.Name: entry
entry.Description: A single entry in the resource bundle.

resource.Name: resource
resource.Description: A single resource returned as part of this bundle.

_status.Name: _status
_status.Description: In Netherlands environments, this extension maps an orderâ€™s status to OrderStatusCodelijst, if possible

asNeededBoolean.Name: asNeededBoolean
asNeededBoolean.Description: If set to true, indicates that the order is only performed when needed within the specified schedule.

authoredOn.Name: authoredOn
authoredOn.Description: The order instant. This is the date and time when the status is not draft or unknown.

code.Name: code
code.Description: External codings for procedures linked to the order.

context.Name: context
context.Description: Reference to the encounter resource in which the ProcedureRequest was placed.

doNotPerform.Name: doNotPerform
doNotPerform.Description: This is set to true if the status is draft, cancelled, or unknown.

intent.Name: intent
intent.Description: The intent code. The full list of potential values can be found here.

profile.Name: profile
profile.Description: Available in Netherlands environments only. This environment shows that this API conforms to the profile connected to the following canonical url: http://nictiz.nl/fhir/StructureDefinition/zib-ProcedureRequest

occurrenceTiming.Name: occurrenceTiming
occurrenceTiming.Description: This event element is populated for auto-released orders.

priority.Name: priority
priority.Description: The priority. The full list of potential values can be found here.

reasonCode.Name: reasonCode
reasonCode.Description: External codings for diagnosis records associated with this order.

requester.Name: requester
requester.Description: Reference to the Practitioner resource for the practitioner that placed the ProcedureRequest.

status.Name: status
status.Description: The status code. The full list of potential values can be found here.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: Reference to a patient resource for whom the ProcedureRequest was made.
